greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of divisors d of n such that d or n/d is odd.
comment: Might be called UnitaryOrdinarySigma(n): If n=Product p_i^r_i then UOSigma(n)=UnitarySigma(2^r_1)*Sigma(n/2^r_1)=(2^r_1+1)*Product (p_i^(r_i+1)-1)/(p_i-1), p_i is not 2. - _Yasutoshi Kohmoto_, Jun 11 2005
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Index entries for sequences related to sums of divisors
formula: Multiplicative with a(2^e) = 2^e+1 and a(p^e) = (p^(e+1)-1)/(p-1) for an odd prime p.
maple: A069184 := proc(n) local a,f,p,e; a := 1 ; for f in ifactors(n)[2] do p := op(1,f) ; e := op(2,f) ; if p = 2 then a := a*(2^e+1) ; else a := a*(p^(e+1)-1)/(p-1) ; end if; end do; a ; end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 02 2011
mathematica: Table[ Sum[ d*Boole[ OddQ[d] || OddQ[n/d] ], {d, Divisors[n]}], {n, 1, 69}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 26 2013 *)
f[2, e_] := 2^e+1; f[p_, e_] := (p^(e+1)-1)/(p-1); a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Sep 15 2020 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, d*((d % 2) || ((n/d) % 2))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 10 2014
(PARI) a(n)=my(e=valuation(n,2)); sigma(n>>e) * if(e,2^e+1,1) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 10 2014
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 10 2002
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 29 2008 at the suggestion of _R. J. Mathar_
